channel.title: Shop keeper

i try to trade shopkeeper i get disconnected from server,
i want to fix this and make my own shop

item.title: Shop keeper
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

[quote=“rocketscience, post:5, topic:176126”]java.lang.arrayindexoutofboundsException: -53
at client.parseincomingpackets(client.java:14206)
at client.packetprocess(client.java:13202)
at client.process(client.java:13172)
at playerhandler.process(playerhandler.java:136)
at server.main(server.java:45)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 25, 2008, 11:57:13 PM[/size][hr]Starting TestScape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594
ClientHandler: Accepted from 127.0.0.1:2350
Client type: low memory version
UserId: 19369788
zakinth has signed onto server.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -53
at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:14206)
at client.packetProcess(client.java:13202)
at client.process(client.java:13172)
at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:136)
at server.main(server.java:45)
Game saved for player zakinth
ClientHandler: Client zakinth disconnected.
ClientHandler: Accepted from 127.0.0.1:2351
Client type: low memory version
UserId: 19369788
zakinth has signed onto server.[/quote]
Ok this is caused by the buffer getting thrown off. Some packetsize or whatnot is screwed up, so the offset of the stream gets off. When the server reads the next packet type, its really part of the payload of the packet before it. It applies the decryption and gets a negative value, then tries to get the packetSize with packetSizes[packetType].
Now since packetType is negative, arrayIndexOutofBounds is thrown. Fix whatever is causing the offset to be messed up.

Oh and good luck.

Read full topic
